item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: Hawkes Bay Today, National, Rotorua Daily Post, Bay of Plenty Times, Northern Advocate, Anzac Day
item.title: PM joins thousands standing at dawn on Anzac Day like no other
item.description:
Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says it will be an Anzac Day like no other, but the purpose of honouring the Anzac commitment and "enduring hopes of peace" remains the same.
The Covid-19 lockdown has ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/25-DPT-dawnpm001_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern stands at dawn on the driveway of Premier House with her father Ross Ardern, left and partner Clarke Gayford. Photo / Pool

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/25-DPT-dawnpm005_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern stands at dawn on the driveway of Premier House with her father Ross Ardern, left and partner Clarke Gayford. Photo / Pool

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/ImagefromiOS_70x72.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=An RNZAF officer stands outside her house in Hobsonville Point at dawn to attend ANZAC Day under lockdown. Photo / Dean Purcell
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/220420NZHMCWEDNESDAY04_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The Cenotaph, Auckland War Memorial Museum. Photo / Michael Craig

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/220420NZHMCWEDNESDAY08_70x71.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=A virtual service is designed to bring people in isolation together this Anzac Day during the Covid-19 lockdown. Photo / Michael Craig
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/220420NZHMCWEDNESDAY12_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Sunrise over the Cenotaph - Auckland War Memorial Museum. Photo / Michael Craig

item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: Spotlight, National, Coronavirus
item.title: In pictures: Kiwis gather in their bubbles to pay their respects on Anzac Day
item.description:
The Covid-19 lockdown took away the Anzac Day dawn parades but New Zealanders did not let the pandemic stop them from paying their respects to our war heroes.
Up and down the country, respecting social ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/25-DPT-dawnpm003_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern stands at dawn on the driveway of Premier House with her father Ross Ardern, left and partner Clarke Gayford. Photo / Pool

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/ScreenShot2020-04-25at7_70x70.png?media_subtype_id=16|caption=New Zealanders gathered at their letterboxes to pay their respects on Anzac Day in lockdown. Photo / Supplied, Dean Purcell

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/ImagefromiOS_70x74.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Nikolaus Furhoff stands at dawn with thousands of others up and down New Zealand. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/ImagefromiOS_70x73.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Residents of Hobsonville Point stand in the street at dawn for ANZAC Day under lockdown. Photo / Dean Purcell

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202017/ImagefromiOS2_70x71.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=An RNZAF officer who did not want to be named stands outside her house in Hobsonville Point at dawn to attend ANZAC Day under lockdown. Photo / Dean Purcell
